title: 'I had incurable breast cancer – but doctors didn't take my symptoms seriously'
text:
When Jo Myatt was diagnosed with secondary breast cancer in her liver, she was both distraught and furious that for years doctors had missed the warning signs that her condition had returned. A new report out today shows she is not alone

Sitting in her doctor’s office on a Friday afternoon, a flood of emotions filled Jo Myatt. She had just been told that, at the age of 40, she had incurable metastatic breast cancer in her liver, 10 years after she had been diagnosed and treated for primary breast cancer.

“As well as feeling devastated, I felt so unbelievably stupid,” says Jo, 43. “I didn’t know what he was talking about. I was told if you have mammograms every year, if you continue to check...
description: When Jo Myatt was diagnosed with secondary breast cancer in her liver, she was both distraught and furious that for years doctors had missed the warning signs that her condition had returned.
